channel.title: Client Issue
channel.description:
Error:
http://prntscr.com/4prdsj
I've changed all settings to my host for my server, and to local ip both give the same error. revision is already set to 718 in all files and the other thing is set to 1 in all files

item.title: Client Issue
item.dc:creator: @Tim5698 Tim5698
item.description:
@Tim5698 wrote:

I’ve already portforwarded, I matched up 127.0.0.1 for the IP, to try connecting locally, it gives the same thing as if I were to put the servers IP as my host, or connected to VPS. I even tried redownloading on a different computer, and it gives a total different error that’s worse lol.

Run code:
“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.8.0_20\bin\java.exe” -Xmx256m -Xss2m -Dsun.java2d.noddraw=true -XX:+CreateMinidumpOnCrash -XX:CompileThreshold=1500 -Xincgc -XX:+UseConcMarkSweepGC -XX:+UseParNewGC -cp bin;./clientlibs.jar; Loader
echo ======Startup successful! Enjoy your adventure!======
pause

Read full topic

item.title: Client Issue
item.dc:creator: @The_Web_Guy The Web Guy
item.description:
@The_Web_Guy wrote:

I can throw my two cents in about this problem… The client is having problems connecting to the server. Make sure the client is connecting to 127.0.0.1, that’s if you’re running the server locally, if not, make sure it matches the IP of wherever your server is running. If everything clears, check the port. If that also clears, then try running the server before you run the client. Also, if you’re hosting your server on a different computer or VPS, and the IP and ports are correct, make sure you’ve portforwarded/allowed the correct port through the firewall.

Read full topic
